results.title: The Professors Are Using ChatGPT, and Some Students Aren’t Happy About It
results.abstract: Students call it hypocritical. A senior at Northeastern University demanded her tuition back. But instructors say generative A.I. tools make them better at their jobs.

results.title: A Toxic Pit Could Be a Gold Mine for Rare-Earth Elements
results.abstract: At the Berkeley Pit, researchers hope to extract valuable metals to increase U.S. production of rare earths used in electric cars, medical advances and national defense.

multimedia.caption: Ongoing extraction inside the Continental Pit operated by Montana Resources — an open pit mine in Butte, Mont. The company is working with researchers at the nearby closed Berkeley Pit, which holds a toxic brew now being examined for rare earths.

results.title: A Book Points to Biden’s Decline and Democrats’ Cowardice: 6 Takeaways
results.abstract: The book, “Original Sin,” describes how Mr. Biden’s aides quashed concerns about his age. But the anonymous accounts show that many Democrats are still afraid to discuss the issue publicly.

multimedia.caption: The book’s reliance on anonymous sourcing reveals the enduring chill that President Biden’s loyalists have cast over a Democratic Party still afraid to grapple publicly with what many say privately was his waning ability to campaign and serve in office.

The book’s reliance on anonymous sourcing reveals the enduring chill that President Biden’s loyalists have cast over a Democratic Party still afraid to grapple publicly with what many say privately was his waning ability to campaign and serve in office.

results.title: Pete Buttigieg Stirs 2028 Speculation as He Drops Into Iowa
results.abstract: With Democrats sizing up their 2028 plans, Pete Buttigieg spoke at a town hall in Cedar Rapids and criticized the Trump administration: “The American people bow to no king.”
